intro: Pelargonium oxyaloides, commonly known as the waxleaf geranium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is a popular ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms. Pelargonium oxyaloides prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for gardens and containers.
